segment.source: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection
segment.target: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection

segment.source: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection
segment.target: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection

segment.source: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection
segment.target: Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) users should use Windows Defender Offline (WDO) for malware detection

segment.source: Environments that have the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) Defender tool deployed should instead use the Windows Defender Offline (WDO) protection image for malware detection.
segment.target: Environments that have the Microsoft Diagnostics and Recovery Toolset (DaRT) Defender tool deployed should instead use the Windows Defender Offline (WDO) protection image for malware detection.

segment.source: This applies to all currently supported versions of DaRT.
segment.target: This applies to all currently supported versions of DaRT.

segment.source: These versions include DaRT 7, DaRT 8, and DaRT 8.1, together with their service packs.
segment.target: These versions include DaRT 7, DaRT 8, and DaRT 8.1, together with their service packs.

segment.source: The Windows Defender tool distributes anti-malware updates more frequently than the DaRT Defender tool.
segment.target: The Windows Defender tool distributes anti-malware updates more frequently than the DaRT Defender tool.

segment.source: Because of how the Defender tool integrates into DaRT, all supported DaRT version deployments cannot apply these anti-malware updates to their DaRT images.
segment.target: Because of how the Defender tool integrates into DaRT, all supported DaRT version deployments cannot apply these anti-malware updates to their DaRT images.

segment.source: Without these updates, the DaRT Defender tool quickly becomes outdated.
segment.target: Without these updates, the DaRT Defender tool quickly becomes outdated.

segment.source: To make sure of up-to-date protection at scan time, you should download Windows Defender Offline to create a bootable image for scanning.
segment.target: To make sure of up-to-date protection at scan time, you should download Windows Defender Offline to create a bootable image for scanning.

segment.source: Currently deployed DaRT images do not have to be removed or updated.
segment.target: Currently deployed DaRT images do not have to be removed or updated.

segment.source: We recommend that you deploy the bootable image that is provided by Windows Defender Offline for all future malware scans.
segment.target: We recommend that you deploy the bootable image that is provided by Windows Defender Offline for all future malware scans.

segment.source: Using an outdated version of the DaRT Defender tool could result in undetected malware.
segment.target: Using an outdated version of the DaRT Defender tool could result in undetected malware.

segment.source: For more information about Windows Defender Offline downloads and FAQs, go to the following website: What is Windows Defender Offline?.
segment.target: For more information about Windows Defender Offline downloads and FAQs, go to the following website: What is Windows Defender Offline?.
